      <h1 class="hero-title">About me</h1>

      <p>
        Currently, I am working on silicon microstrip detector studies for the
        <strong>Compressed Baryonic Matter (CBM)</strong> experiment at FAIR (GSI Darmstadt).
        My work includes <strong>optical inspection</strong> and <strong>sensor characterisation</strong>,
        and <strong>image-processing</strong> methods to identify and localize surface defects
        such as implant breaks, open passivation, dust contamination, and damaged AC/DC pads.
      </p>

      <p>
        In parallel, I develop analysis workflows for large simulation and experimental datasets
        using <strong>ROOT/C++</strong> and <strong>Python</strong>, focusing on reproducibility,
        validation, and physics-driven statistical analysis.
      </p>
